title: At least 21 dead after fire breaks out in Gaza residential building, says Interior Ministry
description: At least 21 people, including whole families and children, were killed when a fire broke out at a residential building in a refugee camp in northern Gaza on Thursday, according to Palestinian authorities in Gaza.

title: Mexican state security chief is among the five dead in helicopter crash
description: The state security chief of the central Mexican state of Aguascalientes was among the five people who died in a helicopter crash, according to the state's governor.

title: London's Heathrow Airport faces 'major disruption' as ground handlers prepare to strike
description: London's Heathrow Airport is facing "major disruption" as 350 ground handlers are set to begin a three-day strike over pay on Friday, the Unite union said Thursday.

title: Families of jailed Cuban protesters blocked from meeting US officials
description: United States officials criticized the Cuban government on Wednesday for what it described as "inhumane" interference with the families of jailed Cuban protesters, some of whom were prevented from meeting with US diplomats in Havana.

title: Shootout off the coast of Puerto Rico leaves one CBP agent dead and 2 others injured, agency says
description: One US Customs and Border Protection agent is dead and two others injured after a shootout with suspected drug smugglers off the coast of Puerto Rico, according to agency spokesperson Jeffrey Quiñones.

title: Airbnb CEO on the tech downturn: 'It's like we're all in a nightclub and the lights just came on'
description: After years of seemingly unstoppable growth, the tech industry is now facing the "ultimate reality check" as it confronts broader economic uncertainty and waves of layoffs, Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky told CNN on Thursday.

title: 'Difficult decisions': Britain announces higher taxes and spending cuts in warning sign for other governments
description: The United Kingdom has already entered a recession and is battling decades-high inflation, eroding standards of living for millions of people across the country. Now, Britons must also stomach higher taxes and reductions to public services as the government tries to get its finances on more solid footing — underscoring the tough road ahead.

title: Even though markets were bearish, 401(k) participants kept investing last quarter
description: Stocks and bonds have been turning in volatile, bearish performances this year in an economy marked by high inflation and rising interest rates. But that hasn't deterred most retirement savers, especially the youngest ones.

title: Singapore writes down $275 million in FTX, calls belief in Sam Bankman-Fried 'misplaced'
description: Singapore has become the latest backer of crypto exchange FTX to admit being burned by its spectacular collapse.

title: UK orders Chinese-owned company to sell Britain's biggest chipmaker
description: The UK government has ordered a Chinese-owned company to unwind its takeover of Britain's biggest chipmaker, citing national security concerns.

title: North Korea tests short-range ballistic missile, South Korea says
description: North Korea fired one short-range ballistic missile into waters off the east coast of the Korean Peninsula on Thursday, according to South Korean military officials.
